page.title: 15PLANT ON THE RASKELF ROAD
page.content: {Mr Peacock started the plant hire {business in 1968. He decided on this {occupation because it was the next {best thing to farming. Also he had {only a small amount of capital; at {that time he was in partnership with {his brother. { They started with one JCB that cost {28 shillings (Â£1.40)an hour to hire. {Their busiest time of the year is {April to August but it also depends {on the weather. { The business is not worth as much as {it was five years ago. Also they used {to employ seven or eight workers but {now they employ only three. { Today jobs take the same time as {they did five years ago because {machines have not changed at all {except from the driver's point of view {(more comfort in the cab). Mr Peacock {says "no way" to expanding the firm. }
